intro: Beilschmiedia inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal beilschmiedia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes other aromatic plants like cinnamon and avocado. The tree typically grows to a height of 15–25 meters and has smooth, greyish-brown bark. Its leaves are elliptic to ovate, with a glossy upper surface and a lighter, sometimes hairy underside. Beilschmiedia inaequalis produces small, white flowers followed by elliptical, woody fruits that contain a single seed.
